definition: to take care of oneself/to provide for oneself
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: "I know he'll never be able to live unsupported, " she says.
sentences.chinese: 銛“我知道，他是再也不可能自理生活了，”她說。

sentences.english: You can upgrade from self-catering accommodation to a hotel.
sentences.chinese: 您可以將自理膳食旅店升級爲酒店。

sentences.english: Worker do sth without authorization asks all fee of doctor pay a home visit all provide for oneself by him worker.
sentences.chinese: 職工擅自請醫生出診的一切費用，均由職工本人自理。

sentences.english: E. g. Most of our accommodation is self-catering.
sentences.chinese: 我們提供的住處大部分是伙食自理的。

sentences.english: Three, room and board can take care of themselves, the surrounding environment elegant, convenient, high school low-grade has.
sentences.chinese: 食宿可以自理，周邊環境優雅，方便，高中低檔均有。

sentences.english: Suddenly you have dependent beings of life to care for.
sentences.chinese: 突然之間你需要照顧一個不能自理的生命。

sentences.english: Results The most required item was to guide the training of self-care(99.3%).
sentences.chinese: 結果患者對指導自理能力訓練期望值達99。

sentences.english: To send children to the army helps cultivate their independence and self-control.
sentences.chinese: 送孩子去參軍有助於培養他們的獨立和自理能力。

sentences.english: No wonder, then, that Smallwood claims the game left him "unable to function independently."
sentences.chinese: 也難怪當時斯默爾伍德稱該遊戲讓他生活不能自理。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, I think that women are more self-sufficient than men.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲一般來說婦女比男性有更強的自理能力。

sentences.english: First, as soon as possible to improve self-care ability.
sentences.chinese: 第一，儘快提高生活自理能力。

sentences.english: Is there a single country that is pure enough to pass muster as a host of a major sporting event?
sentences.chinese: 那兒還又沒有一個國家潔身自理去主辦一場體育盛事？

sentences.english: Organization some outdoor activities, improve their ability of self-dependence.
sentences.chinese: 組織一些戶外活動，提高他們的自理能力。

sentences.english: Self-supporting students are responsible for all your medical fees.
sentences.chinese: 非獎學金生醫療費用一切自理。

sentences.english: But for day-boarders, their self-care ability are influenced by many factors.
sentences.chinese: 而走讀幼兒的自理能力則受許多因素的影響。

sentences.english: Party B shall bear all expenses incurred when staying on after the contract expires.
sentences.chinese: 受聘方合同期滿後，在華逗留期間的一切費用自理。

definition: lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living
disabled/handicapped/deformity on a person or animal
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
to tend/to take care of sb
unable to move freely/difficult to get about
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
to support/to provide support for/to maintain
